remarks: If a sequence is eventually at most ` A ` , then the limsup is also at most ` A ` .  (The converse is only true if the less or equal is replaced by strictly less than; consider the sequence ` 1 / n ` which is never less or equal to zero even though the limsup is.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-May-2016.)

limsupbnd.3 $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR* ) $.
limsupbnd1.4 $e |- ( ph -> E. k e. RR A. j e. B ( k <_ j -> ( F ` j ) <_ A ) ) $.
limsupbnd1 $p |- ( ph -> ( limsup ` F ) <_ A ) $.
